Coordinator

Class Task

  • java.lang.Object
    • Coordinator.Tasks.Task
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Task.BinaryClause, Task.Equivalence, Task.LiteralRemoval, Task.Purity, Task.Satisfiability, Task.ShortenedClause, Task.TrueLiteral, Task.Unsatisfiability

    public abstract class Task
extends java.lang.Object
    The purpose of this class and its subclasses is to fill a Priority Chain with prioritizes tasks to be executed. The smaller the listPosition the earlier the tasks are executed.
    Created by ohlbach on 10.10.2018.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Task.BinaryClause
      It contains a newly derived two-literal clause
      static class  Task.Equivalence
      It contains a newly derived equivalence class
      static class  Task.LiteralRemoval
      It removes a literal from a clause This task can be generated by an external processor which has different data structures
      static class  Task.Purity
      It removes pure clauses
      static class  Task.Satisfiability
      It contains a Satisfiable object.
      static class  Task.ShortenedClause
      It contains a newly shortened clause with at least 3 literals.
      static class  Task.TrueLiteral
      It contains a newly derived unit literal.
      static class  Task.Unsatisfiability
      It contains an Unsatisfiable object.

      • makeTrue

        public boolean makeTrue(int literal,
                        java.util.ArrayList<Task> tasks)
        takes care of a true literal which is still in the task queue
        Parameters:
        literal - a true literal
        tasks - for adding new tasks
        Returns:
        true if a contradiction was detected

      • execute

        public abstract Result execute()
        The method executes the task. It must be implemented in the subclasses
        Returns:
        the result of execution
